metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15309 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - low.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in wolfSSL before 4.5.0, when single precision is not employed. Local attackers can conduct a cache-timing attack against public key operations. These attackers may already have obtained sensitive information if the affected system has been used for private key operations (e.g., signing with a private key).

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.5.0+dfsg-2').
